jobs.title: Enterprise Account Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Coder is looking for an Enterprise Account Manager to grow our diverse customer base. You’ll help bring Coder’s Environment-as-a-Service platform to some of the largest companies in the world, who are focused on executing AI-centric software development at scale. This role is about building trusted relationships, shaping deals, and making sure enterprise customers clearly see the value we deliver.

Day to day, you will manage the full sales cycle, from sourcing opportunities to closing contracts. You’ll work side by side with engineers, buyers, and internal partners to remove friction and move complex deals forward.

What you’ll do here

  • Build and close a strong pipeline of enterprise accounts with large engineering organizations

  • Generate qualified opportunities through outbound prospecting and inbound leads

  • Lead compelling demos that differentiate Coder, and communicate our value with clarity and conviction

  • Collaborate with Sales Engineers to deliver a thorough technical evaluation

  • Partner with decision-makers and technical stakeholders throughout the sales cycle

  • Travel as needed to support deals and customer relationships

What we’re looking for

  • Currently based in the United Kingdom

  • 5+ years in software sales with a strong prospecting background (ideally Developer, Agent, DevSecOps, or Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) technologies)

  • 3+ years selling into Fortune 500 companies

  • Experience engaging with software engineering leaders and technical decision-makers

  • Understanding of DevOps, CI/CD, platform engineering, and developer tools

  • Experience with GenAI & Agentic development tools (Cursor, Claude, Winsurf, Goose, Copilot, etc)

  • Comfortable with outbound motion and partnering with Sales Engineers

  • Track record of exceeding quota and pipeline goals

  • Strong communication skills - written, verbal, and in presentations

  • Familiarity with different sales cycles (startup, midsize, enterprise)

  • Creative, analytical, and highly self-motivated

  • Ability to travel up to 15%

Bonus tacos if you have

  • A technical background or meaningful experience with open source software

  • Curiosity about emerging AI workflows, developer tools, and general tech trends

About Coder

Coder is an AI software development company leading the future of autonomous coding. We empower teams to build software faster, more securely, and at scale through the collaboration of AI coding agents and human developers. Our mission is to make agentic AI a safe, trusted, and integral part of every software development lifecycle.

Our self-hosted Cloud Development Environment (CDE) is the foundation for deploying agentic AI in the enterprise. It provides a secure, standardized, and governed workspace to deploy autonomous coding agents alongside human developers, accelerating innovation while maintaining control and compliance. Coder's isolated, policy-driven environments improve productivity, cut cloud costs, and reduce data risks. Developers transition to AI at their own pace using their own tools. Platform and security teams can govern, audit, and manage a great developer experience at scale.

Interview process 

We believe that the interview process should be transparent, consistent, and enjoyable. We value your time and hope to complete the interview process in two to four weeks, if schedules allow. Through your interviews, you will meet a mix of individual contributors, managers, and leadership.

AI use during the interview process

As an AI company, Coder embraces the use of AI tools, and we want to be transparent about our expectations as you navigate our interview process.

Not permitted: Using AI assistance during conversational interviews.

Permitted: Using AI tooling for take-home assessments. Please flag where and to what extent it was used in your take-home. Your submission will not be penalized for using AI as long as it is done honestly.

Coder is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

jobs.title: Sales Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Coder is hiring a Sales Engineer to support our growing EMEA customer base. Your deep platform knowledge helps enterprises remove friction from coding and keeps developers in flow.

You partner with Account Executives, guide Fortune 500 pilots, and ensure smooth production rollouts. Together we design, demo, and troubleshoot environments that transform how teams ship code.

What you’ll do here

  • Own the technical relationship with prospects through pre‑sales, and efficiently manage towards a technical win

  • Demo the Coder platform from both the developer and administrator personas

  • Install Coder on cloud and on‑prem Kubernetes or VM infrastructure

  • Run proof‑of‑concepts that prove Coder’s value and accelerate deals

  • Evolve into a subject‑matter expert on Cloud Development Environments and their business impact

  • Serve as the customer’s voice, routing insights to Engineering and Product

  • Log feature requests and issues in our public/private Git repositories

  • Troubleshoot Coder deployments, networking, and Kubernetes components

  • Contribute pull requests to Coder’s documentation

  • Post‑sales support when needed

What we’re looking for

  • 3+ years as a Sales Engineer selling infrastructure or developer tooling

  • Strong customer‑facing skills that win trust with technical stakeholders

  • Ability to translate technical hurdles into business value in real time

  • Understand agentic AI software development use cases and advocate passionately where appropriate

  • Comfortable leading architecture demos and deep‑dive troubleshooting sessions

  • Familiar with enterprise procurement processes and stakeholder dynamics

  • Deep Linux fundamentals and comfort at the command line

  • 3+ years hands‑on with Docker and Kubernetes

  • Experience with AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure

  • 3+ years with Terraform or comparable infrastructure‑as‑code tooling

  • Solid grasp of networking: ingress controllers, proxies, load balancers

  • Startup‑speed execution, ownership mindset, and a player‑coach attitude

Bonus tacos if you have

  • Success at both high‑growth startups and larger software vendors

  • Background in CI/CD, DevOps, or developer‑platform products

  • Experience in platform engineering or developer platform teams

  • Kubernetes, AWS, or related certifications

About Coder

Our mission is to make agentic AI a safe, trusted, and integral part of every software development lifecycle.

Our self-hosted Cloud Development Environment (CDE) is the foundation for deploying agentic AI in the enterprise. Coder's isolated, policy-driven environments improve productivity, cut cloud costs, and reduce data risks. Developers transition to AI at their own pace using their own tools. Platform and security teams can govern, audit, and manage a great developer experience at scale.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As a Software Engineering Manager at Coder, you’ll steer a team of 5-10 world‑class software engineers. You unblock, uplift, and focus the team on the problems that matter - delivering a cutting-edge developer platform loved by customers.

What you’ll do here

  • Lead, coach, and grow a tight‑knit squad of engineers

  • Translate product vision into clear technical roadmaps, driving execution end‑to‑end

  • Hold a high bar for code quality, security, and performance, and instill best practices

  • Collaborate across Product, Design, and GTM to prioritise customer impact

  • Remain hands‑on by reviewing PRs, debugging prod issues, and prototyping

What we’re looking for

  • 5+ years in software development, with 1+ year leading teams

  • Proven track record of shipping software to large enterprise customers

  • Experience contributing to or leading open source projects

Deep technical foundation in:

  • Linux

  • Kubernetes & containers

  • At least one major public cloud (e.g. AWS, GCP, or Azure)

  • IP networking & HTTP fundamentals

Our tech stack

  • Backend: Go, Postgres, GCP, Kubernetes, gRPC

  • Frontend: Typescript, React, Vite

  • IDE Extensions: Typescript, Kotlin

  • Observability: Prometheus, Grafana

  • CI/CD: GitHub Actions

  • General: GitHub, Slack, Discord, Notion

Bonus tacos if you have

  • (Tacos? If you need an ice-breaker, ask how we say thanks by giving tacos!)

  • Significant professional experience with our tech stack

  • Prior work on developer tooling

  • Public open source contributions

  • You still carve out time to code, either at work or on passion projects

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer (Front-end)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Coder is looking for a Staff Software Engineer with a front-end specialization who is excited about shaping the future of cloud-based, AI-powered development. At Coder, you will drive the development of our products through core technology advancements, enterprise features, and developer tooling.

What you’ll do here

  • Collaborate with a talented team to design and develop the future of cloud-based developer environments using TypeScript, React, and a modern tech stack. Your work will shape the tools that thousands of developers rely on every day to write, test, and ship code faster.

  • Be responsible for the overall architecture and tooling around Coder’s frontend

  • Your code is well-structured, performant, well-tested, and documented

  • You help make those around you better through code review, design review, sharing your knowledge, and more

  • Backend: Go, Postgres, GCP, Kubernetes, gRPC

jobs.title: Security Engineer (DevSecOps)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re hiring a Security Engineer to help secure our infrastructure and SDLC! In this role, you’ll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable guardrails and automated workflows. You will work closely with another Security Engineer and the broader Engineering Team.

This role will significantly impact our company's security posture and contribute to a vibrant open-source ecosystem.

What You'll Do Here

  • Harden CI/CD pipelines to ensure pristine supply chain security posture

  • Practice and evangelize an Everything as Code approach (be it infrastructure, configuration, or policy)

  • Design and implement scalable guardrails to secure our multi-cloud infrastructure

  • Automate mundane repetitive tasks to ensure continued adherence to compliance frameworks

  • Triage and review findings from various security tools and collaborate with other Engineers to drive timely resolution

What We're Looking For

  • Currently based in the UK, Ireland or Poland

  • 3+ years of professional experience in a similar capacity

  • Proven CI/CD security prowess (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI etc.)

  • Hands-on Public Cloud experience (AWS and/or GCP preferred)

  • Familiarity with modern security tooling (CNAPP, SAST, SCA)

Bonus tacos

  • (Tacos? If you need an ice-breaker, ask how we say thanks by giving tacos!)

  • Ability to program in a general-purpose language (Go and/or Python preferred)

  • Hands-on experience securing containerized workloads (Docker, Kubernetes)

  • Rudimentary knowledge of compliance frameworks (SOC2, ISO27001)

jobs.title: FP&A Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As Coder’s FP&A Manager, you’ll help scale how we plan, invest, and learn. Your work turns numbers into choices, clear trade-offs, faster cycles, and healthier growth.

You’ll own company planning, forecasting, and performance management in partnership with leaders across Product, Engineering, Marketing, and G&A. You’ll build driver-based models, strengthen systems, and turn insights into action.

Success in this role requires analytical depth, executive presence, polished communication skills, agility in navigating ambiguity, and the ability to influence senior decision-makers through clear, data-driven storytelling

This role reports to the Sr. Director of Strategic Finance and may manage analysts as we grow.

What you'll do here

  • Lead the company planning rhythms: Lead the annual operating plan, monthly forecasts, and long-range planning

  • Run monthly BvA & Forecast reviews: Deliver clear, actionable monthly reporting and variance analysis (BvA) as well as updated projections for executives and budget owners;

  • Own and maintain FP&A systems: Serve as the business owner for our budgeting and forecasting tool (Datarails); driving enhancements, maintaining data integrity, and partnering with Accounting and RevOps to improve automation and reporting

  • Partner cross-functionally: Work with G&A, R&D, and GTM leaders on headcount, investments, and ROI cases - driving budget accountability and ownership

  • Enhance systems and processes: Strengthen data integrity across our ERP,, Datarails, and Salesforce; automate reporting and dashboards to raise visibility into KPIs

  • Collaborate with Accounting: Ensure accurate revenue recognition, expense tracking, and close processes; manage accruals and support reconciliations

  • Provide insights and recommendations: Identify trends, risks, and opportunities; translate complex data into strategic guidance for leadership

  • Support strategic projects: Contribute to board materials, fundraising prep, pricing analyses, and other cross-functional initiatives

What we're looking for

  • 5–7 years of experience in FP&A, strategic finance, or corporate finance within SaaS or Enterprise Software.

  • Strong command of financial modeling, forecasting, and scenario analysis

  • Proven ability to partner with and influence senior leaders

  • Experience administering or owning an FP&A system (Datarails, Adaptive, or similar)

  • Working knowledge of ERP (NetSuite or similar), GAAP, and key SaaS metrics (ARR, NRR, CAC, CAC payback, LTV, etc.)

  • Excellent communication and project management skills; able to distill complex information into clear business narratives

  • Self-starter with strong ownership and curiosity; thrives in ambiguity and continuous improvement

Our tech stack

  • Salesforce (CRM)

  • Datrails (FP&A Budget / Forecast)

  • NetSuite (ERP)

  • Metronome (usage billing)

  • Campfire (rev rec)

  • Stripe (B2C)

  • Numeric (Accounting Close Tool)

Bonus tacos if you have

  • (Tacos? If you need an ice-breaker, ask how we say thanks by giving tacos!)

  • Experience implementing or scaling FP&A tools and processes

  • Background in early-stage (Series A-C) companies

  • Fluency in SQL or BI tools for analytics, visualization, and reporting

About Coder

Coder is an AI software development company leading the future of autonomous coding. We empower teams to build software faster, more securely, and at scale through the collaboration of AI coding agents and human developers. Our mission is to make agentic AI a safe, trusted, and integral part of every software development lifecycle.

Our self-hosted Cloud Development Environment (CDE) is the foundation for deploying agentic AI in the enterprise. It provides a secure, standardized, and governed workspace to deploy autonomous coding agents alongside human developers, accelerating innovation while maintaining control and compliance. Coder's isolated, policy-driven environments improve productivity, cut cloud costs, and reduce data risks. Developers transition to AI at their own pace using their own tools. Platform and security teams can govern, audit, and manage a great developer experience at scale.

Interview process 

We believe that the interview process should be transparent, consistent, and enjoyable. We value your time and hope to complete the interview process in two to four weeks, if schedules allow. Through your interviews, you will meet a mix of individual contributors, managers, and leadership.

AI use during the interview process

As an AI company, Coder embraces the use of AI tools, and we want to be transparent about our expectations as you navigate our interview process.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager (Partner and Community)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
You connect relationship-driven partner marketing with grassroots developer engagement. Your work keeps programs moving, content shipping, and results measurable - so partners succeed and our community grows.

You plan, launch, and report on co-marketing with partners. You support meetups, Discord, and the Coder Champions Program in close collaboration with Marketing, Partners, Product Marketing, and Revenue. You report to the Director of Marketing.

What you’ll do here

  • Run partner co-marketing, end-to-end. Coordinate partner campaigns, including webinar logistics, content fulfillment, and social/email distribution

  • Keep plans tight, dates met. Maintain an organized partner campaign calendar and Asana board; ensure on-time delivery across events and digital content

  • Enable the field. Maintain a library of partner-branded collateral for Sales; ensure easy access and version control

  • Report with clarity. Prep QBR materials and track performance to pipeline contribution and influenced revenue

  • Grow community programs. Support meetups (IRL and virtual) in San Francisco, Austin, NYC, and London - logistics, venue/vendors, swag fulfillment, RSVPs, post‑event reporting

  • Engage daily on Discord. Partner with the Sr. Community Manager on prompts, QOTDs, AMAs, moderation, and issue routing

  • Celebrate contributors. Coordinate swag and recognition for the Coder Champions (MVP) Program; help track contributions and outcomes

  • Tell the story. Repurpose community and partner wins into blogs, newsletters, and social posts; amplify what’s working

  • Measure what matters. Own KPI tracking across CommonRoom, Discord, HubSpot, and related systems; surface insights and next steps

What we’re looking for

  • 3-5+ years of experience in marketing, ideally in Developer, Agent, DevSecOps, or Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) technologies

  • Proven partner co‑marketing execution: webinars, collateral development, field events, sales enablement

  • Community program experience: planning and executing developer meetups, user groups, or grassroots initiatives

  • Systems fluency in community tools (e.g., Discord, CommonRoom) and CRM/marketing systems (e.g., HubSpot, Asana)

  • Cross‑functional communicator comfortable collaborating with Sales, Product Marketing, and external partners

  • Exceptionally organized with strong project management and attention to detail

  • Logistics pro: coordinate swag, venue sourcing, content delivery, and campaign execution without losing pace

  • Clear reporter: track KPIs and communicate results, learnings, and recommendations.

  • Content instincts: turn tutorials, stories, and highlights into reusable assets

  • Hands-on, collaborative, and proactive; able to work independently while staying aligned to team goals; energized by fast-moving startup environments

Bonus tacos if you have

  • (Tacos? If you need an ice-breaker, ask how we say thanks by giving tacos!)

  • Experience with technology, cloud, or reseller partners

  • Familiarity with developer tools or the platform engineering ecosystem

  • Event experience in San Francisco, Austin, NYC, London, or similar metro tech hubs

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re looking for a detail-oriented, holistic-thinking Product Designer to elevate the quality of design at Coder. You’ll lead end-to-end design across discovery, ideation, and delivery, partnering closely with product managers and engineers to bring clarity and craft to complex problems.

From conducting research and mapping user journeys to crafting intuitive interfaces, you’ll help shape and mature our design practice as part of a small, growing team. You’ll play a key role in defining how collaboration between humans and AI shapes the future of software development.

What you’ll do here

  • Build a deep understanding of developer needs through research and discovery practices

  • Partner with product managers and engineers to uncover unmet customer needs and turn insights into impactful product opportunities

  • Facilitate collaborative ideation and story-mapping workshops with cross-functional partners (PM + Design + Engineering)

  • Create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs in Figma that balance usability, scalability, and visual craft

  • Maintain and evolve Coder’s design system to ensure consistency, accessibility, and continuous UX improvements across the platform

  • Define how humans and AI collaborate in developer tooling

What we’re looking for

  • 3+ years of end-to-end product design experience in the software industry, with a strong foundation in UX principles

  • Insight-driven and seeking to deeply understand customer needs

  • Skilled at untangling complex problems and turning them into simple, scalable, user-centered solutions

  • Proactive and independent, with strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset

  • Curious and growth-minded, with a interest to refining both craft and process

  • Excited about AI and eager to apply emerging technologies to enhance design workflows

Bonus tacos if you have

  • (Tacos? If you need an ice-breaker, ask how we say thanks by giving tacos!)

  • Practice running mixed‑methods research (journey mapping, interviews, usability testing) and synthesizing insights

  • Experience designing developer tools, IDEs, CLIs, or code‑centric workflows

  • Familiarity with GitHub, VS Code, or JetBrains

  • A background in maintaining design systems, tokens, and accessibility standards
